_prev_prog_3.Description: SuperValu's implementation of the PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental releases of ammonia. The plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program (Mechanical Integrity)for the components of the ammonia refrigeration system, and programs for Mangement of Change (MOC) to the ammonia refrigeration system, process hazard analysis (PHA),and Pre- Startup Safety Review. The program also includes operating procedures for the safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requirements for safe work practices (such as safe approaches to welding and similar hot work), and safety requiremenst for contractors (Contractor Qualifications)who may be hired to work on the refrigeration system. Tenant has a procedure in place for performing incident investigations to ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions are taken to minimize the potential for the recurrence of incidents. The program also has a procedure for conducting Compliance Audits to ensure that the PSM program is being implemented at the facility. The PSM written program  also incoporates the facilities emergency response plan and places special emphasis on the handling of accidental releases of ammonia and coordination of emergency response activities with the local fire department and other emergency response organizations.

_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of a Mid-Temperature Cooler Refrigeration System

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

SuperValu Penn - Harrisburg, PA Facility



General



The Supervalu Penn Harrisburg, PA facility located at 3900 Industrial Road is a combination of dry storage and refrigerated spaces.



1.0    Identification of Covered Process - The overall plant charge is less than 25,330 Lbs..



2.0    Program Level - The ammonia refrigeration system falls under the Program 3 guidelines.



3.0    Management of Change - The management personnel with overall responsibility for the program is the General Manager.



4.0    Hazard Assessment - A hazard analysis has been performed on the Ammonia Refrigeration system. Three portions are included in this assessment.



4.1     Worst Case Scenario - The worst Case Scenario, as defined by the EPA; "the owner/operator shall assume that the maximum quantity in the largest vessel is released as a gas over 10 minutes, due to an unspecified failure."   

        Atmospheric dispersion modeling has been performed to determine the distance traveled by the anhydrous ammonia before its concentration decreases to the toxic end point of 0.14mg/L. 



4.2     Alternative Case Scenario - The alternative case scenario was performed as above with the exception that the alternative case involves a relief valve release of 434 lbs over a 10 minute period. The result of this evaluation was a 

        radius of 0.08 miles with an affected population of 0. Please refer to the alternative case section for specific details.



4.3     Five Year Accident History - None.



5.0    Accident Prevention Program - SuperValu Penn - Harrisburg Facility is in full compliance with OSHA Process Safety Management guidelines for the method of Accident Prevention. The Accident Prevention and PSM Programs emphasize: 

        operator training, preventative maintenance, state of the art equipment, use of accurate operating procedures, hazard reviews of the system, ammonia awareness, proper auditing program and inspection programs.



6.0    Emergen

cy Response Program - SuperValu Penn currently has an Emergency Action Plan. The facility is monitored 24 hours a day, 7 days a week by a computer system that dials out to the owners and refrigeration service company if 

        any parameters are violated. The refrigeration service company performs monthly walkthroughs of the facility and has the ability to dial into the control system to monitor the refrigeration system remotely. The emergency action 

        plan is reviewed annually and all parties are to be informed of any facility changes.
